intro: Oreocharis acaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed oreocharis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with a distinctive hooded shape that resembles a helmet. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis acaulis is considered a rare and endangered species.
